**Globe Life Field** is a [baseball park](/wiki/Baseball_park "Baseball park")
under construction in [Arlington, Texas](/wiki/Arlington,_Texas "Arlington,
Texas"). It will serve as the home of the [Texas
Rangers](/wiki/Texas_Rangers_\(baseball\) "Texas Rangers \(baseball\)") of
[Major League Baseball](/wiki/Major_League_Baseball "Major League
Baseball").[8] [Globe Life and Accident Insurance
Company](/wiki/Globe_Life_and_Accident_Insurance_Company "Globe Life and
Accident Insurance Company"), a subsidiary of [McKinney,
Texas](/wiki/McKinney,_Texas "McKinney, Texas")-based [Torchmark
Corporation](/wiki/Torchmark "Torchmark"), owns the naming rights for the
facility through 2048.[9] The new ballpark is going to be constructed across
the street just south of Globe Life Park.

On May 20, 2016, the Rangers announced that they would vacate [Globe Life Park
in Arlington](/wiki/Globe_Life_Park_in_Arlington "Globe Life Park in
Arlington"). The new stadium will be constructed in a public/private
partnership and have a [retractable roof](/wiki/Retractable_roof "Retractable
roof").[10] The ballpark was approved on the following Election Day.[11] [HKS,
Inc.](/wiki/HKS,_Inc. "HKS, Inc.") was announced as the architect on January
5, 2017.[3]

The Rangers cited weather as the reason attendances at Globe Life Park are
lower than in other baseball stadiums in major metropolitan areas, since it is
prone to high temperatures and rain delays. Therefore, the Rangers are
proposing their new ballpark be constructed with a roof. Unlike its
predecessors, the new stadium's center-field will face northeast, instead of
southeast.[12]

In [2008](/wiki/2008_NFL_season "2008 NFL season"), the [NFL](/wiki/NFL
"NFL")'s [Dallas Cowboys](/wiki/Dallas_Cowboys "Dallas Cowboys") managed to
move to a [retractable roof stadium](/wiki/AT%26T_Stadium "AT&T Stadium") due
to the frequent hot weather in the
[Metroplex](/wiki/Dallas%E2%80%93Fort_Worth_metroplex "Dallas–Fort Worth
metroplex"). The venue opened in time for the [2009](/wiki/2009_NFL_season
"2009 NFL season") season. [13]

The preliminary 3D renderings[14] and artwork of the new stadium show the
design to be very similar to the looks and layout of [Minute Maid
Park](/wiki/Minute_Maid_Park "Minute Maid Park"), the [Houston
Astros](/wiki/Houston_Astros "Houston Astros")' stadium. Final designs have
not been unveiled as of August 2017. A new shopping mall, as well as a Loews
Hotel, and a ballpark village are planned to go along with the new stadium.
The Rangers have also planned to make [Globe Life Park in
Arlington](/wiki/Globe_Life_Park_in_Arlington "Globe Life Park in Arlington")
part of the Texas Live! complex. The plans to build the stadium have generated
a mixed reaction. The new stadium will mean a more comfortable environment to
watch baseball but will extend existing taxes used to pay for AT&T Stadium.
According to _[The Dallas Morning News](/wiki/The_Dallas_Morning_News "The
Dallas Morning News")_ , "The deal calls for the city to issue $500 million in
bonds to help pay for the stadium. A half-cent of sales tax, 2 percent hotel
occupancy tax and 5 percent car rental tax would pay off those bonds over an
estimated 30 years. Voters also approved a ticket tax of up to 10 percent and
parking tax of up to $3 at the new stadium. That money would be used for some
of the Rangers' portion of the debt, which was criticized by the opposition
campaign."[15]
